 How to Connect from off Campus
                                 
 
 
 
 Before you begin your research, connect to the Library. 
 
 Install the  GlobalProtect VPN 
 URL: campusvpn.ucr.edu  
 Sign in: NetID and Password 
 Verify: Using  Multi-factor Authentication (MFA)   
 Use: Open any browser and access library resources 
 Pin GlobalProtect somewhere easy to access 
 
 
 
 Connecting from Off Campus 
 Our LibGuide for in-depth instructions on remote access 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Curbside Pickup
                                 
 
 
 
 After almost three months’ closure, as of Monday, June 15, 2020, you can now check out books from the Rivera and Orbach Libraries’ circulating collections via drive-up  Contact-Free Curbside Delivery . 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 COVID-19 Expanded Access
                                 
 
 
 
 Many publishers and other information providers made resources temporarily available to the education and research community.  For the most part, this access has ended.  However, this guide can provide some guidance on what additional access might still be available and other options. 
 Making sure your remote access is working will be critical during this period.  On every page of this guide, we have included information about connecting from home. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Public Libraries
                                 
 
 
 
 During the library closure, keep in mind your public library.  Many libraries are offering curbside pickup, and getting a digital library card at any library in California might be as easy as a phone call.  Some public libraries offer outstanding resources, that we do not have at UCR, such as: 
 
 Language learning through Mango and Pronunciator 
 Chilton Auto Manuals 
 Practice exams 
 Popular Books (electronic and audio) and movies through Hoopla 
 Movies through Kanopy 
 Ebooks and audio books through Overdrive and Cloud Library 
 Major Newspapers 
 Magazines through RB Digital 
 Music through freegal 
 Technical learning through Lynda.com 
 
   
   
   
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 COVID-19 Related Information
                                 
 
 
 
 Many publishers have opened up all of their content related to COVID.  For COVID Related Information, see the guide  http://guides.lib.ucr.edu/coronavirus
